reviewText: This DVD is great. The viewer gets to see a chef before he receives the coveted three michelin stars. This documentary takes place when Passedat still had two stars and closed the restaurant for remodeling. You get to see the chef and sous chefs prepare the new menu. This is a treat. As I have written before, the Inventing Cuisine series to not about learning to cook but why someone spends their life cooking at the highest level. I have watch the Passedat DVD repeatedly and recommend it.
I agree, definitely not enough focus on the food. Slow moving and in one hour we don't see more then 3 dishes. The chef and the restaurant is great! The film production is not.
Not enough focus on his food, but what a great insight into his approach, his character and his reinvention of himself and his restaurant.
